Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now very worn and faded, containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.145)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87659) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87659)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 179 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
